intro: Ethulia luzonica, commonly known as the Luzon spiderwort, is a flowering plant native to the Philippines. It belongs to the family Commelinaceae and is characterized by its striking blue or violet flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded areas of tropical forests. It has lance-shaped leaves and produces small, clustered inflorescences. Ethulia luzonica is valued for its ornamental beauty and is also used in traditional medicine.
